Generation I.Red: Very lazy. Just eats and sleeps. As its rotund bulk builds, it becomes steadily more slothful.
Generation I.Green: (This entry was originally untranslated in English until it was reused in Pokémon FireRed .)
Generation I.Blue: Very lazy. Just eats and sleeps. As its rotund bulk builds, it becomes steadily more slothful.
Generation I.Yellow: Will eat anything, even if the food happens to be a little moldy. It never gets an upset stomach.
Generation I.Stadium: A lazy Pokémon that gets continually fatter by sticking to a cycle of eating and sleeping. Awake only when it eats.

Generation II.Gold: What sounds like its cry may actually be its snores or the rumblings of its hungry belly.
Generation II.Silver: Its stomach's digestive juices can dissolve any kind of poison. It can even eat things off the ground.
Generation II.Crystal: This Pok é mon 's stomach is so strong, even eating moldy or rotten food will not affect it.
Generation II.Stadium 2: What sounds like its cry may actually be its snores or the rumblings of its hungry belly. (Pokémon Red, Silver, or Crystal inserted) Its stomach's digestive juices can dissolve any kind of poison. It can even eat things off the ground. (Pokémon Blue, Gold, or Yellow inserted)

Generation III.Ruby: Snorlax 's typical day consists of nothing more than eating and sleeping. It is such a docile Pok é mon that there are children who use its expansive belly as a place to play.
Generation III.Sapphire: Snorlax 's typical day consists of nothing more than eating and sleeping. It is such a docile Pok é mon that there are children who use its expansive belly as a place to play.
Generation III.Emerald: Snorlax 's typical day consists of nothing more than eating and sleeping. It is such a docile Pok é mon that there are children who use its big belly as a place to play.
Generation III.FireRed: It is not satisfied unless it eats over 880 pounds of food every day. When it is done eating, it goes promptly to sleep.
Generation III.LeafGreen: Very lazy. Just eats and sleeps. As its rotund bulk builds, it becomes steadily more slothful.

Generation IV.Diamond: Its stomach can digest any kind of food, even if it happens to be moldy or rotten.
Generation IV.Pearl: It stops eating only to sleep. It doesn't feel full unless it eats nearly 900 pounds a day.
Generation IV.Platinum: When its belly is full, it becomes too lethargic to even lift a finger, so it is safe to bounce on its belly.
Generation IV.HeartGold: What sounds like its cry may actually be its snores or the rumblings of its hungry belly.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: Its stomach's digestive juices can dissolve any kind of poison. It can even eat things off the ground.

Generation V.Black: When its belly is full, it becomes too lethargic to even lift a finger, so it is safe to bounce on its belly.
Generation V.White: When its belly is full, it becomes too lethargic to even lift a finger, so it is safe to bounce on its belly.
Generation V.Black 2: When its belly is full, it becomes too lethargic to even lift a finger, so it is safe to bounce on its belly.
Generation V.White 2: When its belly is full, it becomes too lethargic to even lift a finger, so it is safe to bounce on its belly.

Generation VI.X: It is not satisfied unless it eats over 880 pounds of food every day. When it is done eating, it goes promptly to sleep.
Generation VI.Y: Its stomach can digest any kind of food, even if it happens to be moldy or rotten.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Snorlax's typical day consists of nothing more than eating and sleeping. It is such a docile Pokémon that there are children who use its expansive belly as a place to play.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Snorlax's typical day consists of nothing more than eating and sleeping. It is such a docile Pokémon that there are children who use its expansive belly as a place to play.

Generation VII.Sun: Its stomach is said to be incomparably strong. Even Muk's poison is nothing more than a hint of spice on Snorlax's tongue.
Generation VII.Moon: It eats nearly 900 pounds of food every day. It starts nodding off while eating—and continues to eat even while it's asleep.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: It doesn't do anything other than eat and sleep. When prompted to make a serious effort, though, it apparently displays awesome power.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: It has no interest in anything other than eating. Even if you climb up on its stomach while it's napping, it doesn't seem to mind at all!
Generation VII.Let's Go Pikachu: Will eat anything, even if the food happens to be a little moldy. It never gets an upset stomach.
Generation VII.Let's Go Eevee: Will eat anything, even if the food happens to be a little moldy. It never gets an upset stomach.

Generation VIII.Sword: It is not satisfied unless it eats over 880 pounds of food every day. When it is done eating, it goes promptly to sleep.
Generation VIII.Shield: This Pokémon's stomach is so strong, even eating moldy or rotten food will not affect it.
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: Its stomach can digest any kind of food, even if it happens to be moldy or rotten.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: It stops eating only to sleep. It doesn't feel full unless it eats nearly 900 pounds a day.
Generation VIII.Legends: Arceus: This glutton appears in villages without warning and devours the entirety of their rice granaries—such occurrences have long been counted among the gravest of disasters.

Generation IX.Scarlet: This gluttonous Pokémon eats constantly, apart from when it's asleep. It devours nearly 900 pounds of food per day.
Generation IX.Violet: Its stomach's digestive juices can dissolve any kind of poison. Eating things off the ground doesn't bother it at all.

Generation V.Black 2: Trade with Yancy / Curtis in Nimbasa City
Generation V.White 2: Trade with Yancy / Curtis in Nimbasa City
